AutoInterpEvalConfig.description:
Controls all parameters for how autointerp will work.

Arguments:
    model_name:                     The name of the model to use
    device:                         The device to use
    n_latents:                      The number of latents to use
    override_latents:               The latents to use (overrides n_latents if supplied)
    dead_latent_threshold:          The log sparsity value below which we consider a latent to be dead
    seed:                           The seed to use for all randomness

    buffer:                         The size of the buffer to use for scoring
    no_overlap:                     Whether to allow overlapping sequences for scoring
    act_threshold_frac:             The fraction of the maximum activation to use as the activation threshold
    total_tokens:                   The total number of tokens we'll gather data for.
    batch_size:                     The batch size to use for the scoring phase
    scoring:                        Whether to perform the scoring phase, or just return explanation
    max_tokens_in_explanation:      The maximum number of tokens to allow in an explanation
    use_demos_in_explanation:       Whether to use demonstrations in the explanation prompt

    n_top_ex_for_generation:        The number of top activating sequences to use for the generation phase
    n_iw_sampled_ex_for_generation: The number of importance-sampled sequences to use for the generation phase (this
                                    is a replacement for quantile sampling)

    n_top_ex_for_scoring:           The number of top sequences to use for scoring
    n_random_ex_for_scoring:        The number of random sequences to use for scoring
    n_iw_sampled_ex_for_scoring:    The number of importance-sampled sequences to use for scoring

model_name.description: The name of the model to use
model_name.title: Model Name

n_latents.description: The number of latents for the LLM judge to interpret
n_latents.title: Number of Latents

override_latents.description: The latents to use (overrides n_latents if supplied)
override_latents.title: Override Latents

random_seed.description: The seed to use for all randomness
random_seed.title: Random Seed

dataset_name.description: The name of the dataset to use
dataset_name.title: Dataset Name

llm_context_size.description: The context size to use for the LLM
llm_context_size.title: LLM Context Size

llm_batch_size.description: Split up total tokens into batches of this size
llm_batch_size.title: LLM Batch Size

llm_dtype.description: The data type to use for the LLM
llm_dtype.title: LLM Data Type

buffer.description: The size of the buffer to use for scoring
buffer.title: Buffer Size

no_overlap.description: Whether to allow overlapping sequences for scoring
no_overlap.title: No Overlap

act_threshold_frac.description: The fraction of the maximum activation to use as the activation threshold
act_threshold_frac.title: Activation Threshold Fraction

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens we'll gather data for
total_tokens.title: Total Tokens

scoring.description: Whether to perform the scoring phase, or just return explanation
scoring.title: Scoring

max_tokens_in_explanation.description: The maximum number of tokens to allow in an explanation
max_tokens_in_explanation.title: Max Tokens in Explanation

use_demos_in_explanation.description: Whether to use demonstrations in the explanation prompt
use_demos_in_explanation.title: Use Demos in Explanation

n_top_ex_for_generation.description: The number of top activating sequences to use for the generation phase
n_top_ex_for_generation.title: Number of Top Examples for Generation

n_iw_sampled_ex_for_generation.description: The number of importance-sampled sequences to use for the generation phase
n_iw_sampled_ex_for_generation.title: Number of IW Sampled Examples for Generation

n_top_ex_for_scoring.description: The number of top sequences to use for scoring
n_top_ex_for_scoring.title: Number of Top Examples for Scoring

n_random_ex_for_scoring.description: The number of random sequences to use for scoring
n_random_ex_for_scoring.title: Number of Random Examples for Scoring

n_iw_sampled_ex_for_scoring.description: The number of importance-sampled sequences to use for scoring
n_iw_sampled_ex_for_scoring.title: Number of IW Sampled Examples for Scoring

AutoInterpEvalConfig.title: AutoInterpEvalConfig

autointerp_score.description: AutoInterp detection score, using methodology similar to Eleuther's 'Open Source Automated Interpretability for Sparse Autoencoder Features'
autointerp_score.title: AutoInterp Score

description: An evaluation of the interpretability of SAE latents. This evaluation is based on Eleuther's 'Open Source Automated Interpretability for Sparse Autoencoder Features'

eval_id.description: A unique UUID identifying this specific eval run
eval_id.title: ID

datetime_epoch_millis.description: The datetime of the evaluation in epoch milliseconds
datetime_epoch_millis.title: DateTime (epoch ms)

eval_result_metrics.description: The metrics of the evaluation, organized by category. Define your own categories and the metrics that go inside them.
eval_result_metrics.title: Result Metrics Categorized

eval_result_details.description: Optional. The details of the evaluation. A list of objects that stores nested or more detailed data, such as details about the absorption of each letter.
eval_result_details.title: Result Details

sae_bench_commit_hash.description: The commit hash of the SAE Bench that ran the evaluation.
sae_bench_commit_hash.title: SAE Bench Commit Hash

sae_lens_id.description: The ID of the SAE in SAE Lens.
sae_lens_id.title: SAE Lens ID

sae_lens_release_id.description: The release ID of the SAE in SAE Lens.
sae_lens_release_id.title: SAE Lens Release ID

sae_lens_version.description: The version of SAE Lens that ran the evaluation.
sae_lens_version.title: SAE Lens Version

eval_result_unstructured.description: Optional. Any additional outputs that don't fit into the structured eval_result_metrics or eval_result_details fields. Since these are unstructured, don't expect this to be easily renderable in UIs, or contain any titles or descriptions.
eval_result_unstructured.title: Unstructured Results

title: AutoInterp
